Description: Yellow painted pottery shabti of Shedkhons, pure-priest of Amun, with black detail: a lappet-wig tied with a fillet, a damaged face, crossed hands in relief holding two hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a seed-basket; the foot section has broken away.
Curator's comments: In set with .9462 In set with .9463 In set with .9464 In set with .9465
Condition: incomplete - foot section missing, head damaged
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
